item.title: PRISM Breakup workshop screencast
item.description:
What an amazing weekend we had at PRISM Breakup! Thanks so much to the organizers, Heather Dewey-Hagborg, Allison Burtch, Aurelia Moser, and Ramsey Nasser. It was easily among the best art/tech events I've been to, and a pleasure to be involved.

I just uploaded a screencast from the workshop on Sunday, that you can watch on YouTube. Thanks to everyone who came out, and especially to those who took an Occupy.here router home!

item.title: Release 2
item.description:
After very helpful early feedback from Twitter user @pe5pe, we discovered that release 1 had a couple serious flaws:

  1. The way we were setting up the initial network configuration was kind of a bad idea
  2. We omitted a key file in the release, opt.img (which is too big to store in GitHub!)

Download: Occupy.here release 2

item.title: Occupy.here at PRISM Breakup
item.description: Dan just posted an essay about occupy.here on Rhizome: A tiny self-contained darknet. (That's the new tag line here, in case you hadn't noticed it.)

item.title: Occupy.here at PRISM Breakup
item.description:
We're giving a workshop at PRISM Breakup: How to build a tiny self-contained darknet. Starts 12:30pm on Sunday October 6, 2013, at Eyebeam (540 W 21st St, NYC). Bring a laptop!

Dan will also be giving a talk at 4:30pm.

item.title: Release 1
item.description:
After nearly two years of development, the first official release is now ready for download.

Download: Occupy.here release 1

item.title: Occupy.here at EXPO 1
item.description: Occupy.here was commissioned by Triple Canopy to provide a virtual library for their school and lecture series at MoMA PS1's EXPO 1, titled Speculations (“The Future Is ___________”). You can watch the archived LiveStream of Dan’s talk.

item.title: Occupy.here at IDEAS City
item.description: Come to the occupy.here workshop on Friday May 3rd, part of the IDEAS CITY festival organized by the New Museum.

item.title: Occupy.here at SXSW 2013
item.description: Occupy.here is at South by Southwest, presenting with Harlo Holmes of The Guardian Project and Isaac Wilder of the Free Network Foundation. Come see our panel on Saturday morning! (see also: one year ago in Austin)

item.title: Occupy.here in Hyperallergic
item.description: There's an interview with founder Dan Phiffer in the art blog Hyperallergic. Thanks Ben!

item.title: Rhizome
item.description: We’re really honored to have received a Rhizome commission! Soon we'll have the funding to deploy a new round of public wifi nodes.
